description.narrative: The main objective of the Institutional strengthening phase X project is aiming at strengthening Georgias capacity in implementing obligations under the Montreal protocol.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Variety of trainings targeting different beneficiaries; Resource materials prepared to increase the level of awareness and education; Technical support provided to the NOU, so that its' functioning is maintained. Technical support to the RAC sector;

comment.narrative: Government of Georgia requires assistance in enforcement of ODS consumption and import/export monitoring system, additional capacity building efforts specifically in line with new legislative operations.

1. Adopted relevant ODS regulation to control and monitor ODS consumption 2. Efficiently and timely collected and reported ODS data 3. Effectively supervised HCFC phase-out activities 4. Raised public awareness on Ozone Layer protection

1. 25 customs officers trained in theory and practice on national regulatory base, international obligations related to ODS, revealing illegal import or transit of ODS, and application of refrigerant identifiers. 2. 19 environmental inspectors trained on technical characteristics /specifications, use, inspection, and revealing incompliances of ODS-based appliances/installations. 3. E-learning materials (e-learning modules) for the environmental inspectors and customs officers prepared. 4. Terms of reference (ToR) (algorithms/protocols) prepared for the web-based monitoring system for control of import and movement of ODS substances within the country. 5. National Ozone Unit (NOU) in fulfilling country’s reporting obligation of providing accurate, comprehensive and timely data to the Secretariat of the Montreal Protocol on ODS consumption - data collected and analysis prepared on ODS consumption in 2019. 6. 23 Refrigeration and air conditioning technicians trained on the national regulatory and policy frameworks related to ODS, application and handling of low or zero GWP alternatives, including natural refrigerants, alternative technologies and energy efficiency measures and safe handling of ODS based equipment. 1 set of natural refrigerant analyzer was purchased for the training purposes. 7. Training materials prepared and training conducted for the employees of the public organizations engaged in the procurement services, on the green public procurement issues in the sector of cooling / air conditioning. 8. Public campaign to raise awareness of general public on the Ozone Layer protection through celebrating the World Ozone Day, webinar for more than 80 “eco-leaders” organized in cooperation with the EIEC.

1. Adopted relevant ODS regulation to control and monitor ODS consumption 2. Efficiently and timely collected and reported ODS data 3. Effectively supervised HCFC phase-out activities 4. Raised public awareness on Ozone Layer protection

1/ Package of legal amendments on ODS exempt uses, permitting and quota requirements, monitoring and reporting was prepared. The final package was provided to the MInistry of Environmental Protection and Agriculture (MEPA) to commence the initiation of governmental approval process. The package is expected to be adopted in 2020
2/ National Ozone Unit (NOU) assisted in fulfilling country’s reporting obligation of providing accurate, comprehensive and timely data to the Secretariat of the Montreal Protocol on ODS consumption: the data collected from various sources and analysis prepared for ODS consumption in 2018.
3/ Refrigeration and air conditioning 24 certified technicians participated in the trainings that covered topics on the national regulatory and policy frameworks related to ODS for ensuring that technicians are well aware of legal requirements related to consumption of ODS in the RAC sector, application and handling of low or zero GWP alternatives, including natural refrigerants, alternative technologies and energy efficiency measures and safe handling of ODS based equipment. Comprehensive assessment of the needs in vocational education and training (VET) sector to implement modern, high standards courses was conducted. The action plan was developed to support arrangement of the future activities leading to the improved capacities on national level to prepare skillful RAC technicians.
4/ The project launched campaign to raise awareness of general public on the Ozone Layer protection through celebrating the World Ozone Day. In the frameworks of the campaign the project jointly with the Environment Information and Education Center (EIEC) arranged seminars and workshops to increase understanding on practical activities of ozone protection. 150 schoolchildren coming from all over Georgia attended those seminars. The campaign was broadcasted at the various TV channels.
Continue enforcing ODS control measures and monitoring of illegal ODS trade
UNDP helped improve system for enforcing of ODS control measures and monitoring of illegal ODS trade through developing several modules of ODS control web-based monitoring system.
